Summary I have led an interesting two-career life. While I've spent most of my career in Information Technology, I've also worked as a Law Clerk to the Honorable G.R. Smith. I was privileged to work with such an exemplary judge for so long. Under his tutelage, my research and writing skills have blossomed. I have had the opportunity to learn and apply Constitutional law on a daily basis, and I have mastered the Federal Rules of Civil and Criminal Procedure.  
 
My IT skill set spans the gamut. My time at IBM has been a gift. Moving back into IT has been a challenge but the work is fulfilling. My knowledge and expertise continues to expand on a daily basis at IBM.

Honors & Awards Student Scientific Session - 3rd place award June 2014 I won the 3rd place offered by Siemens company and by the university committee with a project called "Remote Ligh Control". The scope of this project was to design, develop and implement a remote light control system which can bee installed in a "green house". 
The project combined two parts, software and hardware. 
The hardware part has been implemented using a Siemens operating touch panel, an Arduino board and different connectors, bulbs and light sensors being controlled trough the system logic.  
For the software part the system logic has been written in STEP7 Manager, an appropriate program for the automation system. The human interface has been created in WinCC. Experience Windows Infrastructure Specialist IBM United Kingdom Ltd May 2011  – Present (4 years 4 months) United Kingdom Project:  
To deliver a new resilient security infrastructure project for the UK Security Services. Part of the resilience infrastructure team brought in to deliver the new services across the UK. My responsibilities are as Windows platforms team leader, governance of the designs from conceptual node stages through to delivery into support. This role has given me greater exposure to key components such as IBM AIX operating systems, and IBM hardware.  
 
Scope of responsibilities: 
•	Platforms Team leader reporting to the Lead Infrastructure and Chief engineers, my role was to own the design of the Windows components for the new resilience infrastructure spread across the UK  
•	Responsible for all areas of the Windows design components, including Active Directory and all the security policies associated, McAfee E-Policy Orchestrator (EPO) design and deployment, Microsoft Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) and Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 
•	To provide server platform and infrastructure High Level & detailed design documentation. 
•	Make & influence key design decisions based on System Architecture Design requirements and technology platforms available. 
•	Responsible for designing the Microsoft Windows OS platforms based on Windows Server 2008 R2, on IBM System X Hardware Infrastructures. 
•	Making technical decisions based on Microsoft & AIX platform technologies
